title: Google SheetsSTDEV.P Function

metadata.description: Learn about Google SheetsSTDEV.P Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Google Sheets
STDEV
content_sections.content:
.P Function

STDEV.P Function
The
STDEV.P
function is a premade function in Google Sheets, which calculates the
Standard Deviation (Stdev)
for the entire population.

content_sections.title: It is typed
content_sections.content:
=STDEV.P
and gets a list of cells:
=STDEV.P(
value1
,
[value2, ...]
)
You can
select cells one by one, but also ranges, or even multiple ranges.
The STDEV.P function ignores cells that do not contain numbers.
Note:
Standard deviation (σ) measures how far a 'typical' observation is from the average of the data (μ). You can read more about standard deviation in the
Statistics - Standard Deviation Chapter
.
Tip:

content_sections.title: There is another function called
content_sections.content:
=STDEV.S
that can be used if you have the data for a
sample
.
Let's have a look at an example!
Stdev.p Function Example
Find the standard deviation of the total stats for all of the Pokemon in the population:
Note:
The full dataset continues after row 14, all the way down to row 759.
The
STDEV.P
function, step by step:
Select the cell
E3

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=STDEV.P
Click the
STDEV.P
command
Specify the range
B2:B759
for the Total stats for all the Pokemon
Hit enter
Now, the function returns the standard deviation of all the Total stat values:
The
STDEV.P
function has successfully returned the
Standard Deviation
for the whole population as
113,9159026
.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Google SheetsSTDEV.P Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Google SheetsSTDEV.P Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Google SheetsSTDEV.P Function and how to apply it in your projects.
